name: 林正釧
objective: Granular material flows are commonly occurred in many industrial applications and nature hazards, such as fluidized bed, additive manufacturing, and debris avalanche. To provide a comprehensive understanding for granular materials flows, this course will be divided into three parts. We start from the basic flow characteristics of granular materials and its rheological models. Then, we will move to the simulation approaches for granular material flows in view of continuum and discrete description. Finally, the two-phase suspension system will be introduced, followed by the demonstration of practical industrial and geophysical applications for these complex flows.
schedule:
Week   Topic
1. Overview of granular material flows
2. Classification of fluid behavior: Newtonian and non-Newtonian fluid
3-4. Introduction to granular material flows (I): Flow characteriastics
5-6. Introduction to granular material flows (II): Rheology and phenomenological model
7-8. Introduction to granular material flows (III): Micro-mechanisms and boundary conditions
9-10. Discrete simulation: Discrete element method 
11-12. Continuum simulation: Computational Fluid Dynamics
13-14. Two-phase suspension flow
15. Final Examination
16-18 Practical applications & final project presentations
